content: palace gate pattern and photos tiina kuu tech editing helena kahan inspired by the main gate of buckingham palace this design honours the memory of the late queen elizabeth ii yarns and yardage colour 1 c1 adelia fibers merino sock 75% merino 25% nylon 424 m / 100 g 25-35 grams of light pink hattara colourway colour 2 c2 freija yarn merino sock 75% merino 25% nylon 425 m / 100 g 40-55 grams of grey greyhound colourway any fingering weight yarns can be used size gauge there are instructions for sizes small 60 sts 36 sts and 44 row in stockinette with smaller medium 66 sts large 72 sts and extra-large needles = 10 cm / 4 inches 78 sts which are referred to in the 36 sts and 36 row in stranded colourwork instructions as s m l xl if only one stitch with larger needles = 10 cm / 4 inches count is given it applies to all sizes sizes s m l xl fit a foot circumference of approximately 18 5 20 5 22 24 cm / 7½ 8 8¾ 9½ inches with some negative ease needles sizes 2 0 mm / us0 and 2 5 mm / us1½ or suitable to obtain gauge circular needles at before you start least 80 cm / 32 inches long please read the instructions carefully the dpns two shorter circulars or a mini circular bor is at the centre back of the leg but shifts can be used but the instructions have been to the start of the instep for the foot and toe written for magic loop a temporary bor is added for working the stranded colourwork on the leg and sole to ensure the pattern is as jogless as possible other supplies supplies for provisional cast-on stitch markers tapestry needle palace gate socks page 1/4 instructions chart a chart key folded picot cuff with c1 and smaller needles cast on 60 66 72 78 sts in total using the turkish or any other provisional cast-on technique of your choice distribute sts across needle 1 and needle 2 as desired join to begin working in the round being careful not to twist rnds 1-8 i e 8 rnds knit round 9 work *yo k2tog k1* repeat * - * to the end of the round rnds 10-18 i e 9 rnds knit undo the provisional cast-on if necessary and pick up 60 66 72 78 sts along the provisional cast-on edge onto a spare circular needle fold the work along round 9 leaving stockinette facing out and the provisional cast-on edge to the inside knit each stitch from the outside needle together with the corresponding stitch on the inside needle thus attaching the hem leg work 1 round in stockinette stitch next round knit to last 2 sts of the round place a cut c1 and continue with c2 only switch to temporary bor marker this is a temporary smaller needles if desired knit 2 rnds bor for
